Posted By: Minus_Prime (9/22/2010 5:00:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is great for those people who play with power.  
  
Attack turn 2 with a haste creature or later with a trampler and you may be in a decent health lead. Makes it more fun if your creature has a [Mage Slayer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mage Slayer) or if you cast [Soul's Fire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul's Fire). Play it on your favorite two-mana double striker turn 3 and you'll make enemies. ([Viashino Slaughtermaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Viashino Slaughtermaster), [Boros Swiftblade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Swiftblade))  
  
My Jund deck throws down a [Spark Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spark Elemental), casts this, attacks with the elemental, and sacs it to an [Ooze Garden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ooze Garden) before you're forced to sac it, giving you a 7/7 for five mana and two cards. The only trick is keeping the elemental alive until your second main phase.
posts.html:
This card is great for those people who play with power.

Attack turn 2 with a haste creature or later with a trampler and you may be in a decent health lead. Makes it more fun if your creature has a Mage Slayer or if you cast Soul's Fire. Play it on your favorite two-mana double striker turn 3 and you'll make enemies. (Viashino Slaughtermaster, Boros Swiftblade)

My Jund deck throws down a Spark Elemental, casts this, attacks with the elemental, and sacs it to an Ooze Garden before you're forced to sac it, giving you a 7/7 for five mana and two cards. The only trick is keeping the elemental alive until your second main phase.
